results.title: Une Bombe par hasard
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a stranger comes upon a town and notes the total absence of populace. The townspeople, from their safe position on the hill, watch with concern as the stranger approaches the bomb. In the end only the stranger escapes the explosion.
results.description: An animated film in which a stranger comes upon a town and notes the total absence of populace. The townspeople, from their safe position on the hill, watch with concern as the stranger approaches the bomb. In the end only the stranger escapes the explosion.

results.title: Une Aussi Longue Absence = the Long Absence
results.creator_credit: Jacques Nahum, Claude Jaeger and Henri Colpi
results.brief_description:
In this touching tearjerker, a lonesome owner of a Parisian café spies on a passing tramp. He hums a strangely familiar tune and the woman is convinced that he is her estranged husband who was deported 16 years before. She follows the wanderer back to his miserable shanty beside the Seine, where she learns that he has been an amnesiac since the war. She takes him back to her cafe in the hope that it will jog his failed memory and sees a terrible scar on the back of his head. In her heart, she realises his memory will never return, but this does not stop her from spending the rest of her days trying to get him to remember something from their happy past. With ‘Une aussi longue absence’ Colpi has used his cinematic knowledge to serve a sensitivity, a quality of emotion, a delightful purity and a humanity very rarely seen on the screen nowadays. With images of a great beauty (by Marcel Weiss), the film delivers a remarkable sketch of a suburban community”. Reference: Le Film Francais, 16 June 1961. Awards: Prix Louis-Delluc 1960 ; Palme d’Or Cannes Film Festival 1961.

Credits: Producers, Jacques Nahum, Claude Jaeger; director, Henri Colpi ; writers, Marguerite Duras, Gerard Jarlot, Henri Colpi ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Alida Valli, Georges Wilson, Amedee, Charles Blavette, Nane Germon.

results.title: Une Affaire D'hommes = a Man's Affair
results.creator_credit: Albina du Boisrouvray and Nicolas Ribowski
results.brief_description:
Servolle is a police inspector and Faguet is a real estate dealer who become good friends because of their shared love of bicycling. Servolle is investigating a mysterious series of murders of women. The fourth victim happens to be Lalie, a woman Faguet introduced to the cycling group as his wife.

Credits: Producer, Albina du Boisrouvray ; director, Nicolas Ribowski ; writer, Georges Conchon ; photography, Jean-Paul Schwarz ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Claude Brasseur, Jean-Louis Trintignant, Jean Carmet, Eva Darlan, Beatrice Camurat.

results.title: Underwater medicine
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of the Navy and Bruce Davis
results.brief_description: Shows the work on prevention and treatment of ailments afflicting divers being done by the School of Underwater Medicine at HMAS Penguin, a Naval shore establishment at Balmoral, Sydney. Shows the treatment of injured civilian diver, the education of medical personnel and the research projects being undertaken by the school in association with Sydney universities.

results.title: Undertow 1999
results.creator_credit: David Haines, Joyce Hinterding and Scott Horscroft
results.brief_description:
Since David Haines and Joyce Hinterding began working collaboratively in the late 1990s they have created striking installations, drawing on their shared interest in recurrent residues and latent environmental energies. Their two major works preceding the completion of Undertow 1999 were The Levitation Grounds (1999) and The Blinds and The Shutters (2001). These works presented ominous yet thrilling scenarios where some unspecified prior events have
caused the laws of physics to mutate slightly, allowing occult tendencies to gain precedence. Trees floated in strangely coloured atmospheres; a house launched all of its furnishings into deep-space orbit. Both works showed the exultation and the possible price associated with transgressing the limits that seem to hold a stable physical universe together.

Now with Undertow 1999, Haines and Hinterding have teamed up with sound artist Scott Horscroft to produce a visceral fable about sudden, violently upwelling energies that have been previously repressed, half-remembered or semiconscious. Horscroft brings to the project expertise in the sonic patterns of air turbulence and the special ‘ambience’ that characterises every particular space like a sonic fingerprint. Commissioned by the Federation Square Public Arts Program (with financial assistance from ACMI), the artists were asked to create a work that
specifically responded to the labyrinth (the built-in passive air-conditioning system) underneath Federation Square. The resulting work, Undertow 1999, is a four-screen installation depicting a slow and weightless navigation through the interior of the Square’s functionary maze.Through the use of Steadicam technology and archival footage sourced from ACMI’s film collection, viewers move weightlessly through the space as though peering through their own viewfinder. Accompanied by an enveloping and complex soundscape, we encounter strange and abstract apparitions, levitating objects, mysterious air turbulence and other unstable
phenomena, which appear to seep, rupture and bounce throughout this subterranean world.

results.title: Understanding: family and marriage
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions, Elaine Grand and Pauline Shaw
results.brief_description: This film looks at responsibility within the family, communication between members of a family and married couples and the idea of divorce as it relates to different concepts of the ideal marriage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Granada International Productions, Elaine Grand and Pauline Shaw

results.title: Understanding Wik
results.brief_description: The High Court’s Wik and the subsequent action by the government to, as the PM said, restore the pendulum, has caused great division in the Australian community. Unfortunately, much of the heat in the debate has been caused by ignorance and widespread lack of understanding of the Aborigines’ case. In this high quality video, the basics of the Wik Decision and the federal government’s answer: the now infamous 10 Point Plan and the legislation introduced into parliament late in 1997 are explained simply and concisely. Suitable for Middle Secondary to Tertiary level students.

results.title: Understanding venereal disease
results.creator_credit: Granada Television, Elaine Grand and Pauline Shaw
results.brief_description: A round table discussion between a number of teenagers, a venereal disease specialist and Granada’s compere, is designed to inform teenagers about VD. Specifically informs on the types of VD, their known incidence in Britain, how to recognise symptoms, what should be done about it and where treatment may be obtained. The doctor states that early treatment is most necessary. The young people feel that information on VD should be given in schools as well as information on sex.

results.title: Understanding the Japanese
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Shinichi Koike and Haruhiko Kawamura
results.brief_description: A round-table social commentary by foreigners living in Japan including a professor and an employee of a Japanese company from Australia; a BBC producer as well as a freelance translater from England; a professor from Canada; and a lecturer of comparative culture from America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Shinichi Koike and Haruhiko Kawamura
